noun.description: An upright pillar, typically cylindrical and made of stone or concrete, supporting an entablature, arch, or other structure or standing alone as a monument.
A vertical division of a page or text.
One or more lines of people or vehicles moving in the same direction.
examples: a column of tanks moved northwest

origin: Late Middle English: partly from Old French columpne, reinforced by its source, Latin columna pillar.
